definition: to drive a wedge between (allies, partners etc)
mythical beast (archaic)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
surname Li
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between

sentences.english: He always sows dragon's teeth between them.
sentences.chinese: 他总是在他们之间挑拨离间。

sentences.english: She broke them up out of jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 出于嫉妒之心，她离间了他们的关系。

sentences.english: He sowed discord among his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他在朋友中间挑拨离间。

sentences.english: When the opportunity comes all we can do is to take this challenge.
sentences.chinese: 当际遇离开，我们能够做的，只是接受这个离间。

sentences.english: All they wanted was to make bad blood between them, aggravate differences and fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 他们就是要挑拨离间，扩大分歧，以便浑水摸鱼。

sentences.english: I think you are instigating Dr. Dirt to form a negative feeling toward me.
sentences.chinese: 我认为妳是在挑拨离间阿土博士和我的感情。

sentences.english: The endangered ranger's estrangement deranged my long-range plan.
sentences.chinese: 遭受危险的看林人的离间搅乱了我的长期计划。

sentences.english: Mrs Smith enjoys setting people at loggerheads.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯太太喜欢挑拨离间。

sentences.english: All they wanted was to make bad blood between them and fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 他们所要做的就是挑拨离间，混水摸鱼。

sentences.english: Spiteful gossip separated the two old friends.
sentences.chinese: 恶意的流言蜚语离间了这对老朋友。

sentences.english: This seems like a recipe for alienating rich countries.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是离间富国不错的法子。

sentences.english: He is sowing discord among his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他在朋友中间挑拨离间。

sentences.english: These dodgy documents could allow mischief-makers to impersonate supposedly secure websites.
sentences.chinese: 挑拨离间者可用这些虚假的许可证冒充安全网站。

sentences.english: LiMi they decided to use the program to deal with QinQiong and DuGuCheng.
sentences.chinese: 李密决定用离间之计对付秦琼和独孤盛。

definition: to incite disharmony/to instigate
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to provoke
to incite/to stir up/to instigate
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
stratagem of sowing dissension/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to instigate (rebellion etc)/incitement (e.g. to desertion within opposing camp)
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to employ a stratagem
harboring unfathomable motives (idiom)
evil plan/evil schemes
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
to frame/to bring false charges against
to be suspicious and jealous of
